You can use Microsoft Teams and SharePoint Newsfeed to provide enterprise social features in SharePoint.
No
Explanation: Enterprise social features in SharePoint are provided by Viva Engage (formerly Yammer) and Newsfeed, not Microsoft Teams.

You can disable the enterprise social collaboration feature in SharePoint.
Yes
Explanation: SharePoint administrators can disable enterprise social collaboration features by turning off either Viva Engage or Newsfeed in the SharePoint admin center.

You can use different enterprise social collaboration services in SharePoint simultaneously.
No
Explanation: Administrators can choose either Viva Engage or Newsfeed as the enterprise social collaboration service in SharePoint, but not both simultaneously.

Webhooks- Microsoft Teams enables your users with outgoing webhooks, incoming webhooks. Outgoing webhooks enable your users to send text-based messages to your organization's web services. Your services can then respond with a message consisting of text or a card that includes text and image-type content.
Incoming webhooks are also available. Incoming webhooks enable your external services to send messages to your Teams channels through an HTTP endpoint. This is useful for notification and tracking tools.
Connectors- Connectors are a way for your users to subscribe to receive alerts and information from your web services.
